Package com.drbhagwat.chapter.one

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Exercise15
    The following program is a solution to Exercise15 of Chapter1.
    Exercise16
    The following program is a solution to Exercise16 of Chapter1.
    ExerciseEight
    The following program reads a string and prints all of its substrings.
    ExerciseEleven
    Write a program that reads a line of text and prints all the characters that are not ASCII together with their Unicode values.
    ExerciseFive
    What happens when you cast a double (that is larger than the largest possible int value) to an int.
    ExerciseFour
    Write a program that prints the smallest and largest positive double values: Hint: Lookup Math.nextUp in the Java API.
    ExerciseFourteen
    Write a program that reads a two dimensional array of integers and determines whether it is a magic square (i.e., whether the sum of all rows, all columns, and the diagonals is the same).
    ExerciseNine
    "String comparison" has an example of two strings s and t so that s.equals(t) but s != t.
    ExerciseOne
    Write a program to read an integer and print it in binary, octal, hexadecimal, and its reciprocal as a hexadecimal floating-point number.
    ExerciseSeven
    This program reads in two integers between 0 and 4294967295 (both inclusive), stores them in int variables, and computes and displays their unsigned sum, difference, product, quotient, and remainder.
    ExerciseSix
    This program computes 1000! using BigInteger.
    ExerciseTen
    Write a program that produces a random string of letters and digits by generating a random long value and printing it in base 36.
    ExerciseThirteen
    Write a program that prints a lottery combination, picking six distinct numbers between 1 and 49.
    ExerciseThree
    Using only the conditional operator, write a program that reads 3 integers and prints the largest.
    ExerciseTwo
    Write a program to read an integer angle and normalize it to a value between 0 and 359 degrees, Give two solutions - the first with the % operator, and the second with the floorMod.
